isis.stitle: VT-365 Diesel Engine Diagnostics (2002) - HARD START AND NO START DIAGNOSTICS - Test Procedures - EST Data List

svcprocinfo.para: To determine if engine systems meet operating specifications to start engine

svcsubproc.title: Monitoring Engine Systems using an EST

item.para: Electronic Service Tool (EST) with Master Diagnostics Software
International® EZ-Tech Interface Cable

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, read all safety instructions in the foreword of this manual. Follow all warnings, cautions, and notes.

note.para: Batteries must be fully charged before doing test procedures.
If an EST is not available, see alternate test procedures following this test.

step1.para: See Appendix A in this manual for specifications, and record on Hard Start and No Start Diagnostics form.
Open Hard Start No Start.ssn to monitor engine operation.
Crank engine for 20 seconds and read EST to measure VBAT, RPM, ICP, EOP, and EGRP.

item.para: Battery voltage must be 7 or more volts. If voltage to the Electronic Control Module (ECM) drops below 7 volts, the ECM will not remain powered up. If the ECM does not get power through the ECM relay, the engine will not start.
Engine cranking speed must generate the required Injection Control Pressure (ICP) to operate the fuel injectors and create required compression to ignite the fuel.

If the EST shows 0 RPM during engine cranking, the ECM may not be receiving a signal from the Crankshaft Position (CKP) sensor or Camshaft Position (CMP) sensor. The ECM will not send the fueling command to the IDM without a correct CKP or CMP signal. See CKP sensor and CMP sensor in Section 7.
If the EST indicates low or no ICP, do Test 16 (Low ICP System Pressure).
If oil pressure is low, the ICP system is not receiving enough oil.
If EGR valve is open at startup it can disrupt the air fuel mixture enough to inhibit engine operation.
Defective batteries
High resistance at battery cable connections or in wiring to the ECM
Defective ECM power relay
Blown in-line fuse (in battery box) that supplies voltage to the ECM
Blown fuse in power distribution box
Electrical system malfunctions, incorrect oil, or long oil change intervals in cold ambient temperatures
No RPM indication on the EST while cranking the engine: defective CKP sensor, CMP sensor, or circuit to the ECM. Recheck DTCs after cranking engine for 20 seconds.
A leak in the high pressure oil system, a defective ICP sensor, or defective IPR valve
Low oil level in the high pressure oil reservoir
Defective high pressure oil pump or pump drive
Defective IPR valve or electronic controls for the regulator
Defective oil pressure regulator valve
Defective gerotor oil pump
Internal lube oil pressure leak
Stuck or defective valve
Defective position sensor

svcsubproc.title: Monitoring Engine Systems using a Breakout Box

item.para: Breakout box
DMM

note.para: Make sure V IGN is turned off.

step1.para: Remove (X-1, X-2) and (X-3, X-4) connectors from ECM.
Install breakout box connectors (X-1, X-2) and ( X-3, X-4) to ECM.
Install wiring harness connectors to breakout box headers (X-1, X-2) and (X-3, X-4).

warning.para: To prevent serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle - comply with the following:
When routing DMM leads, do not crimp the leads, run the leads too close to moving parts, or let the leads touch hot engine surfaces.

step1.para: Connect DMM leads to breakout box
Crank the engine for 20 seconds and use DMM to measure values for the following:

para.emph: V BAT (DMM set to DC V)

item.para: POS X3 - 3 to NEG X3 - 7 ( V IGN Pwr)
POS X4 - 1 to NEG X3 - 6 (ECM Pwr)
POS X4 - 2 to NEG X3 - 7 (ECM Pwr)

para.emph: RPM (DMM set to DC mV Hz)

item.para: POS X1 - 1 to NEG X3 - 7 (CKP)

para.emph: RPM (DMM set to DC mV RPM 2)

item.para: POS X1 - 9 to NEG X3 - 7 (CMP)
POS X1-20 to NEG X1- 6
POS X2-7 to NEG X1-6
POS X2-9 to NEG X1-6

note.para: See Appendix A and Section 7 for operational voltages and values.

svcsubproc.title: Monitoring ICP using pressure sensor breakout harness

item.para: Pressure sensor breakout harness
DMM

step1.para: Remove engine harness connector from ICP sensor.

figure.caption: Pressure sensor breakout harness installed - ICP

warning.para: To prevent serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle - comply with the following:
When routing DMM leads, do not crimp the leads, run the leads too close to moving parts, or let the leads touch hot engine surfaces.

step1.para: Connect pressure sensor breakout harness to engine harness and ICP sensor.
Use DMM to measure ICP while cranking engine for 20 seconds.

item.para: Connect POS to green (signal circuit) and NEG to black (signal ground).

note.para: See Appendix A and Section 7 for operational voltages and values.

svcsubproc.title: Monitoring EGRP using EGR Breakout harness

item.para: EGR breakout harness
DMM

step1.para: Remove engine harness connector from EGR valve.

warning.para: To prevent serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle - comply with the following:
When routing DMM leads, do not crimp the leads, run the leads too close to moving parts, or let the leads touch hot engine surfaces.

step1.para: Connect EGR breakout harness to engine harness and EGR valve.
Use DMM to measure EGR position while cranking engine for 20 seconds.

item.para: Connect POS to green (signal circuit) and NEG to black (signal ground).

note.para: See Appendix A and Section 7 for operational voltages and values.

svcsubproc.title: Monitoring EOP at Lube Oil Pressure Test Port

item.para: Fuel/ oil pressure test coupler
Gauge bar (0-60 psi gauge)

step1.para: Connect fuel/oil pressure test coupler in line with gauge bar (0-60 psi gauge).

warning.para: To prevent serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle - comply with the following:
When routing test line , do not crimp the line, run the line too close to moving parts, or let the line touch hot engine surfaces.

step1.para: Monitor EOP while cranking engine for 20 seconds.
